Description: Bright-blue glazed composition long convex bicone bead, broken at one end.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Mostagedda, Grave 3248 Found in front of the knees of a woman
Curator's comments: Also from this burial: beads (1930,0711.342 & 1930,0711.343 & 1930,0711.344), necklaces (1930,0711.348 & 1930,0711.349 & 1930,0711.350 & 1930,0711.351), shell (1930,0711.347). Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937). 120; pl.LXXXVI, 20; Tomb register, pl. LXXI: Bead register. pl. LXXIB.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (589)
